<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Reflect Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=624) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=323" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=166" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 104 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 201 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=633)

</column>

---

When you successfully use Counterspell to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell’s effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it’s an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.
name: Reflect Spell
